home.heroSubtitle: Complete financial platform for sports associations and small organizations
home.docStorageDesc: Secure cloud storage for all association documents, contracts, and important files in one organized place.
home.finCalcDesc: Calculate taxes, budgets, and expenses with tools designed for sports associations and non-profit organizations.
home.revenueDesc: Monitor multiple revenue streams including membership fees, donations, sponsorships, and grants.
home.memberDbDesc: Organize and manage members, track competitions, schedule events, and maintain complete records.
home.aboutText1: Orient is built specifically for sports associations and small organizations needing professional financial management without complexity. Store documents, track income from membership fees and donations, calculate taxes, and manage your entire member database.
home.aboutText2: From youth sports associations to amateur clubs, we provide the tools you need to stay organized, compliant, and financially healthy.
home.contactSubtitle: Join hundreds of associations managing their finances with Orient.

about.title: About Orient
about.subtitle: Empowering small organizations through better financial management
about.missionText1: Orient was created with a simple but powerful mission: to give sports associations and small organizations access to professional financial tools that are easy to use and affordable.
about.missionText2: We believe that a lack of resources should not stand in the way of amazing organizations doing amazing work. Whether you run a youth sports league, an amateur club, or a community organization, you deserve access to the same quality tools that larger companies use.
about.storyText1: Founded in 2025 during "Techship at Hetch" out of a common frustration: how complicated and disorganized the finances for a small sports association were. Spreadsheets were scattered, receipts went missing, and it was hard to know when payroll would happen.
about.storyText2: We set out to build a better solution. One that would centralize everything in one place, make financial tracking simple, and give small organizations the insights they need to make smart decisions about their money, regardless of their circumstances.
about.simplicityDesc: Financial management should be simple, not complicated. We design for clarity and ease of use.
about.accessibilityDesc: Every organization deserves great tools, regardless of size or budget.
about.reliabilityDesc: Your data is valuable. We ensure it is always secure, backed up, and available when you need it.
about.communityDesc: We are here to support the organizations that support their local communities.
about.trustText: See why associations across the country trust Orient.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: We'd love to hear from you and answer your questions
contact.talkText: Whether you're interested in starting a free trial, have questions about our services, or need help with your account, we're here to help.
contact.faq1Q: How does the free trial work?
contact.faq1A: Sign up for a 14-day free trial with full access to all features. No credit card required.
contact.faq2Q: What types of organizations do you support?
contact.faq2A: We work with sports associations, clubs, non-profits, and small community organizations of all kinds.
contact.faq3A: Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade your subscription at any time from your account settings.
contact.faq4A: Absolutely. We use bank-level encryption to protect your data and perform regular backups.
contact.messageSentText: Thank you for contacting us. We will get back to you as soon as possible.

settings.authRequiredText: You must be logged in to access Organization Settings.
settings.noOrgText: You are not part of any organization.
settings.noPermissionText: Only owners and administrators can change organization settings.
settings.orgNameHint: Contact support to change the organization name
settings.logoHint: Link to image file for the organization logo.
settings.merchantNumberHint: Your company's Swish number for Swish Commerce.
settings.environmentHint: Select TEST to use Swish test environment (MSS), or PROD for real payments.
settings.certificateHint: Upload the .p12 certificate you received from your bank for Swish Commerce.
settings.passphraseHint: The password that protects your .p12 certificate.
settings.step1: Ensure your organization has a Swish Commerce agreement with your bank
settings.step2: Get your Swish Number (merchant number) from your bank
settings.step3: Get your .p12 certificate and password from your bank
settings.step4: Fill in the information above and click "Save Swish Configuration"
settings.noteEncrypted: Note: The certificate and password are stored encrypted in the database.
settings.exportDesc: Here you can export all accounting data to a SIE4 file that can be imported into other accounting software (e.g. Fortnox, Visma).
settings.inviteText: Share this invite code with new team members:
settings.deleteOrgText: Permanently delete this organization. This cannot be undone.
settings.merchantGuideText1: To accept Swish payments in the system, your association/organization needs its own Swish Commerce number.
settings.step1Text: Contact your bank ask to sign an agreement for Swish Commerce (sometimes called Swish Företag). It is important that it is "Commerce" for the API to work.
settings.step2Text: When the agreement is ready, you will receive a Swish number that usually starts with 123....
settings.step3Text: Enter this number in the "Swish Number" field on this page. Also ensure you have access to the Certificate Management via the bank.
settings.certGuideIntro: For the system to communicate securely with Swish, a digital certificate (security file) is required. This only needs to be done once, but can be tricky if you're not used to computers.
settings.option1Text: Do you have someone technically skilled in the association? Ask them to help. Copy the text below and send it to that person:
settings.helpRequestText: Hi! We need help getting a TLS certificate for Swish Commerce for the association. We need to generate a CSR, sign it with Swish (via the bank), and then package the key and certificate into a .p12 file (PKCS#12) and password protect it. Can you help us with that?
settings.option2Text: If you want to do it yourself, you need to use your computer. Follow these steps carefully:
settings.certStep1: Log in to the bank: Go to your internet bank for business and find "Swish Commerce". There is usually a link to "Certificate Management".
settings.certStep2: Create the file: Often the bank has a guide for how to create the certificate. They can sometimes help via phone. The goal is to have a file on your computer that ends in .p12 or .pfx.
settings.certStep3: Password: When the file is created, you choose a password. It is very important that you remember this!
settings.certStep4: Upload: When you have the file on your computer, click "Choose File" here and upload it. Then enter the password.
settings.techStep1: If you are using the terminal (OpenSSL):
settings.techStep2: Upload CSR to Swish, download the PEM file, and then run:
